channel.title: Help fixing computer
channel.description:
Well my sister went on a 8 month trip, and i borrowed her laptop sometimes when i needed it for example doing a homework or doing some programming, however one day i had nothing to do and i installed ubuntu for about 3 days and after that i uninstalled it(that was about 6 months ago?!) and no problems.. But now my sister was using her laptop today and i dont really know what was she doing but whatever i feel guilty, when we start up the computer this pops up [img]http://img687.imageshack.us/img687/5427/img00062201006030056.jpg[/img]
and when i click to continue this pops up
[img]http://img229.imageshack.us/img229/1276/img00066201006030105.jpg[/img]

item.title: Help fixing computer
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

[quote=“Strucker, post:14, topic:540285”][quote author=SilentCJ link=topic=659142.msg4408970#msg4408970 date=1392918693]
Use a Windows DVD and repair, it will rewrite the default Windows bootloader back to the hard drive. Had to do this so many times.

As much as I love wiping things and starting from scratch, it’s stupid to do so, this is just a simple fix…
[/quote]would i lose any info?[/quote]
None at all, takes like 2 minutes.

Read full topic

item.title: Help fixing computer
item.dc:creator: @strucker Strucker
item.description:
@strucker wrote:

[quote=“SilentCJ, post:13, topic:540285”]Use a Windows DVD and repair, it will rewrite the default Windows bootloader back to the hard drive. Had to do this so many times.

As much as I love wiping things and starting from scratch, it’s stupid to do so, this is just a simple fix…[/quote]would i lose any info?[quote=“relmitos, post:9, topic:540285”]Try booting from a cd.[/quote]im gonna try that :)[quote=“Miss Silabsoft, post:12, topic:540285”]buy a new harddrive install os use current hdd as slave[/quote]its a laptop…

thanks guys, i didnt answer all but i did read all, gave my some ideas.

Read full topic

item.title: Help fixing computer
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

Use a Windows DVD and repair, it will rewrite the default Windows bootloader back to the hard drive. Had to do this so many times.

As much as I love wiping things and starting from scratch, it’s stupid to do so, this is just a simple fix…

Read full topic

item.description:
@silabsoft wrote:

buy a new harddrive install os use current hdd as slave

Read full topic

item.title: Help fixing computer
item.dc:creator: @thiefmn6092 thiefmn6092
item.description:
@thiefmn6092 wrote:

Pure_:

You didn’t uninstall grub properly.

Read full topic

item.title: Help fixing computer
item.dc:creator: @Ashi Ashi
item.description:
@Ashi wrote:

Easiest method I think would be to use a Linux live CD and then just copy the files over. If you use Ubuntu the disk should show up allowing you to drag and drop files to a USB or something. Then just reinstall everything.

Read full topic

item.title: Help fixing computer
item.dc:creator: @relmitos relmitos
item.description:
@relmitos wrote:

Try booting from a cd.

Read full topic

item.title: Help fixing computer
item.dc:creator: @xx_matty_xx Justin Bieber
item.description:
@xx_matty_xx wrote:

[quote=“Strucker, post:6, topic:540285”][quote author=Pure_ link=topic=659142.msg4408832#msg4408832 date=1392866007]

[quote author=Strucker link=topic=659142.msg4408826#msg4408826 date=1392864268]

[quote author=Pure_ link=topic=659142.msg4408470#msg4408470 date=1392769170]
You didn’t uninstall grub properly.
[/quote] yep, i’ve noticd that, only know to follow all the steps when shit like this happens to u haha.
But is there anyway i can fix it without formatting it?

[/quote]Just connect the HDD to another and preserve sensitive data then format it??? Stop messing around with it more than you already have.
[/quote]thats the problem, i dont know whats sensitive data for my sister, if it was my hdd i would’ve already formatted it, but she has important stuff well…[/quote]Copy the entire home directory?? If she’s put shit in C:\ then that’s her own fault.

Read full topic
